↳ In-reply-to ¬ª Summer is back for a bit. We had 23¬∞C today and I went up my mountain. On the way home I encountered a deer maybe seven meters away from me. Every now and then the smell of rotten fruit was in the air, a few farmers mowed their grasslands, so freshly cut grass odor was a nice and welcome contrast.

content.html:
üì£ Updates to Search Engine:

  • Remove the default fuzziness of 1 (but see below)
  • Fixed several bugs in the pager (trying searching for ‚ÄúHello World‚Äù and sort by ‚ÄúOldest‚Äù)
  • Try to auto-detect the type of the query string by parsing it as a query string, if that fails default to match query‚Ä¶

This last feature GuessQueryType() now allows advanced users to type in a Query String query and letting the backend figure out that‚Äôs what you meant. So for example you can search for terms with fuzziness quite easily by just typing in the search box: fuck~1 (for example) or search for mentions by typing in mentions:prologic@twtxt.net ‚Äì Enjoy ü§ó #Twtxt #Yarn.social #Search #Engine

See‚Ä¶ Data Center fires üî• do happen ü§£ ‚Äì Some colleagues I used to work with didn‚Äôt believe me when I told them that fires in Data Centers are possible üòÖ

But on Linux, WebKit2GTK is always lightyears behind Firefox/Chromium in terms of ‚Ä¶ everything. That‚Äôs my experience with running WebKit2GTK browsers for well over a decade (luakit, uzbl, dwb, whatever). I even made my own browser at some point, but I recently basically decided to give up on it and go back to Firefox.

content.html:
↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @eaplmx idk, I don't remember magazines throwing flashing videos in front of the page I'm trying to read, tracking what I was looking at at all times (even when I'm not looking at the magazine) and correlating that with existing databases about me, purposely subverting my attempts to stop some of that from happening.......

@abucci@anthony.buc.ci Its‚Äô this part that really bugs me the most. This ‚Äúwar‚Äù on data and personal information. These assholes have figured out a way to make our personal digital lives and activities a highly valued commodity as well as to weapons it. Its digesting and its got to stop.

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @prologic I don‚Äôt have the best experience with WebKit, at least not with WebKit2GTK on Linux. MacOS might be different, I don‚Äôt know. But on Linux, WebKit2GTK is always lightyears behind Firefox/Chromium in terms of ‚Ä¶ everything. That‚Äôs my experience with running WebKit2GTK browsers for well over a decade (luakit, uzbl, dwb, whatever). I even made my own browser at some point, but I recently basically decided to give up on it and go back to Firefox.

@movq@www.uninformativ.de But I do see your point‚Ä¶ Just tried to say login to my pod with this toy browser and that doesn‚Äôt work for some reason ‚Äì 400 Bad Request ‚Äì This thing has no cookie storage? ü§î

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @prologic I don‚Äôt have the best experience with WebKit, at least not with WebKit2GTK on Linux. MacOS might be different, I don‚Äôt know. But on Linux, WebKit2GTK is always lightyears behind Firefox/Chromium in terms of ‚Ä¶ everything. That‚Äôs my experience with running WebKit2GTK browsers for well over a decade (luakit, uzbl, dwb, whatever). I even made my own browser at some point, but I recently basically decided to give up on it and go back to Firefox.

@movq@uninformativ.de Whilst I agree with everything you said‚Ä¶ That‚Äôs just it though isn‚Äôt it‚Ä¶ Is ‚Äúmost‚Äù of the Web really that great in the first place? ü§î I mean Wikipedia works, my pod works, my website works, so basically I‚Äôm good üòÖ I tend to think the way @markwylde does here in that most of the web is utter garbage in the first place.

To give you another perspective‚Ä¶ I run AdguardTeam/AdGuardHome: Network-wide ads in my home network as the primary DNS for all our devices. This is great as it removes all (most?) of the ‚Äúgarbage‚Äù out there on the so-called ‚ÄúWeb‚Äù. But‚Ä¶ Every now and again, some random shit won‚Äôt work, so I have to temporarily disable AdGuard.

But at the end of the day I tolerate this‚Ä¶ Maybe I shouldn‚Äôt and just give up? ü§î (sometimes I certainly feel that way, so i feel your pain/sadness, I share it)
